humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscription from " heart ", " 𢆶 " sound. The characters of the Chu family in the Warring States Period are the same. Xiao Zhuan starts from " heart " and " hereby ". The original meaning is kindness and love from above to below. "Said Wen": "Love and kindness. From the heart, I would like to sound."

Bronze inscriptions express loving kindness, such as the King Zhongshan’s Fanghu: "Love and filial piety." This usage can also be seen in the bamboo slips of the Warring States period, such as "Shangbo Bamboo Book I." "Jian Yi" Jane 13: "Ancient (so) kindness (in order) 㤅 (love), then the people (have) [目辛] (pro)." See also the handed down documents, such as "Zhou Li. Land official. "Da Situ": "One is to be kind to the young, and the other is to provide for the elderly." Zheng Xuan's note: "Being kind to the young means loving the young."

" Charity " also refers specifically to parents loving their children. Such as "Pipe. Situation": "The benevolent, the parents are also good." "Historical Records. Biography of Fan Sui and Cai Ze: "Fathers are kind and filial, husbands believe in wives, and family blessings."

" Charity " also means respecting parents. Such as "Zhuangzi. "Father of Fishers": "If you are relatives, you will be kind and filial, and if you are the emperor, you will be loyal." "The Story of the Three Kings of Wen": "The King of Filial Piety is kind and filial. Whenever he hears that the Queen Mother is sick, he can't eat with his mouth, and he often wants to stay in Chang'an to serve the Queen Mother."

" Chee " extended representation said on behalf of the mother. For example, in the Southern Dynasties Qi Xie Tiao's "Queen Qi Jing's Essays": "Min Yu is not you, Ci Xun has broken early." "Zixun" refers to the mother's lesson. Wang Anshi of the Northern Song Dynasty (to the second sister of Jiangyin from Qianzhou Prefecture): "Shuyun stays in your car to comfort me for kindness." Another example is "Family Kindness", which is a mother who humbly calls himself to others.

The " magnetism " of the magnet is written as " kindness ". The ancients used the magnet to attract iron to compare it with the loving mother and the child. Such as "Lu's Spring and Autumn. "Master": "Ci Shi Zhao Tie, or lead it." "Huai Nan Zi. "Said Mountain": "Cushi can draw iron, and it can't be compared with copper." Later, the word "礠" was added next to the " stone ", which was simplified to " magnetism ".

humanum_full_description:
金文從「心」，「𢆶」聲。戰國楚系文字構形相同。小篆從「心」，「茲」聲。本義是上對下的仁愛、慈愛。《說文》：「慈，愛也。从心，茲聲。」

　　金文表示慈愛，如中山王方壺：「慈孝㝨惠。」此用法亦見戰國竹簡，如《上博竹書一．緇衣》簡13：「古（故）慈㠯（以）㤅（愛）之，則民又（有）[目辛]（親）。」又見傳世文獻，如《周禮．地官．大司徒》：「一曰慈幼，二曰養老。」鄭玄注：「慈幼，謂愛幼少也。」

　　「慈」又特指父母疼愛子女。如《管子．形勢》：「慈者，父母之高行也。」《史記．范睢蔡澤列傳》：「父慈子孝，夫信妻貞，家之福也。」

　　「慈」也指孝敬父母。如《莊子．漁父》：「事親則慈孝，事君則忠貞。」《漢書．文三王傳》：「孝王慈孝，每聞太后病，口不能食，常欲留長安侍太后。」

　　「慈」引申表示母親的代稱。如南朝齊謝朓〈齊敬皇后哀策文〉：「閔予不祐，慈訓早違。」「慈訓」指母親的教訓。北宋王安石〈寄虔州江陰二妹〉：「庶雲留汝車，慰我堂上慈。」又如「家慈」，是對別人謙稱自己的母親。

　　磁石的「磁」本寫作「慈」，古人以磁石引鐵與慈母愛子相比。如《呂氏春秋．精通》：「慈石召鐵，或引之也。」《淮南子．說山》：「慈石能引鐵，及其於銅，則不行也。」後來加注「石」旁分化出「礠」字，又簡化為「磁」。

慈字的基本解释

慈
cí
仁爱，和善：慈爱。慈善。慈悲。慈祥。仁慈。慈和。慈眉善目。
特指“慈母”，多用于对人称自己的母亲：家慈。慈闱。慈颜。慈命。
对父母的孝敬奉养：孝子慈孙。

慈字的汉语字典释义

[①]［cí］
［《廣韻》疾之切，平之，從。］
(1)上爱下；父母爱子女。
(2)爱惜；仁爱。
(3)慈母的省称。多用以自称其母。
(4)指对父母的孝敬。
(5)佛教语。指佛、菩萨爱护众生，给予欢乐。参见“慈悲”。
(6)通“磁”。参见“慈石”。
(7)姓。汉代有慈仁。见《隶释·汉殽阮君神祠碑》。

◎ 慈
kind, loving

慈字的康熙字典解释

【卯集上】【心字部】　慈； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页397第25
【唐韻】疾之切【集韻】【韻會】牆之切【正韻】才資切，?音磁。【說文】愛也。从心兹聲。【精薀】父母之愛子也。【左傳·昭二十六年】父慈子孝，姑慈婦聽。又【儀禮·喪服】慈母如母，謂養母也。　又【禮·內則】慈以甘旨。【註】慈，謂愛敬進之也。　又慈和，服物也。【左傳·文十八年】宣慈惠和。【註】慈者，愛出於心，恩被於物也。　又【增韻】柔也，善也，仁也。　又石名。【精薀】山產鐵於其陽者，慈石產其隂。【郭璞·慈石贊】慈石吸鐵，母子相戀也。俗作磁，非。　又竹名。【竹譜】竹之叢生，子母相依，曰慈竹。　又果名。【羣芳譜】慈姑，一根，歲生十二子，歲閏則十三子，如慈母之乳諸子也。　又州名。唐置慈州。　又姓。漢有慈仁，明有慈止。　从心从兹。【魏校曰】兹也者，養其子而使之長，心乎愛之。俗或譌作㤵。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［cí］
["Guangyun" cut disease, level it, follow. ]
(1) The top loves the bottom; parents love their children.
(2) Cherish; benevolence.
(3) The provincial name of the loving mother. Mostly used to claim to be his mother.
(4) Refers to filial piety to parents.
(5) Buddhist language. Refers to Buddhas and Bodhisattvas who love all living beings and give joy. See "compassion."
(6) Pass "magnetism". See "Tzu Shi".
(7) Last name. There was kindness in the Han Dynasty. See "Li Shi·Han Yu Ruan Jun Temple Stele".

A person with horns has you on the ground and lets loose two poops over your heart. "Mercy! Mercy!" You cry, but the horned dude doesn't stop until there are two gross poops sitting on your heart. "M-mercy..." is the only thing you can think to say.
Imagine yourself saying "mercy" over an over as this horned guy has you on the ground and keeps pooping over your heart.

As you shout "Mercy!" one more time, suddenly Jesus (じ) appears out of no where and punches the horned guy into the stratosphere. Jesus snaps his fingers and the poop is gone and you're off the ground. Your heart is safe.
Imagine yourself saying mercy and seeing Jesus appearing just in time to save the day. The word "mercy" must be his bat signal. Jesus signal? Sure.
